name: trained
content:
trained adjective
(PREPARED)
Add to word list
Add to word list
having been prepared for a particular job or activity, by learning skills, getting qualifications, etc.: I didn't realize Emilio was a trained nurse.trained in Are you trained in the use of this equipment?well-trained humorous "Did I hear you say your children cleaned up after the party?" "Oh yes, I have them well-trained!" Trained dogs can detect the early signs of the disease. Opposite
untrained (SKILLS)

trained adjective
(SUPPLIED WITH DATA)
in machine learning (= the study of creating computer systems that can improve their own ability to carry out tasks by analysing new data), a trained system is one that has been supplied with data to improve it: Our trained models and code will be made publicly available for further research.

someone who is trained has been taught the skills and knowledge needed for a particular job or activity: His father was a trained engineer.highly/specially/properly trained A team of specially trained auditors routinely examines all activities on site. trained staff/workers
